channel.title: POLITICO Influence
channel.description: Delivered daily, Influence gives you a comprehensive rundown and analysis of all lobby hires and news on K Street.

item.title: How some lobbyists view the Mike Johnson mess
item.description: K Street is keeping a close eye on Speaker Mike Johnson as his grip on his conference appears to be weakening.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Johnson aide jumps to Holland & Knight
item.description: Chris Jaarda has left the Hill to join Holland & Knight as a partner in the firm’s lobbying practice.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Paramount’s top lobbyist to depart
item.description: DeDe Lea is stepping down as the top global lobbyist for entertainment giant Paramount after nearly 30 years with the company or its predecessors.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Health lobbyists press for ACA extension
item.description: Health insurance premiums are set to go up for millions of Americans on New Year's Day if Congress is unable to reach an agreement to extend the subsidies.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Local governments flock to Manatt
item.description: Los Angeles-based Manatt, Phelps & Phillips is signing local government clients by the dozen.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: AI association reveals first advisory board
item.description: One of the newest trade associations in Washington, the National Artificial Intelligence Association, has appointed its inaugural advisory board.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Tech manufacturer hires Lanza amid calls for US ban
item.description: A Chinese-founded electronics manufacturer facing bipartisan calls for an investigation into its relationship with the Chinese government has hired Bryan Lanza.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Sanctioned Paraguayans hire lobbyist with Rubio ties
item.description: The former Paraguayan vice president and an associate of his who have been banned from entering the United States since 2022 have hired Florida-based Corcoran Partners.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Fugees star sentenced to 14 years in FARA case
item.description: Pras Michel, founding member of 90s hip-hop trio The Fugees, was sentenced to 14 years in prison.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Dems probe K Street ballroom fundraising
item.description: A trio of Senate Democrats want more information about the lobbyists reportedly helping raise money for Trump’s White House ballroom project.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Paramount Skydance’s first lobbying hire
item.description: Paramount Skydance Corporation was formed by one of the most high-profile media acquisitions of the second Trump administration.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: GOP tax hand decamps for K Street
item.description: Kathryn Reed, a top GOP tax aide who helped craft congressional Republicans’ sweeping tax cuts earlier this year, has decamped from the Hill after nearly a decade.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Scoop: How the left’s dark money behemoth spent its millions
item.description: The left’s preeminent dark money hub dished out nearly $311 million in 2024 backing progressive causes like abortion and voting rights, climate change and more.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Water business is booming
item.description: Current Strategies, which launched as the only public affairs firm in Washington focused on water infrastructure and policy, filed its first disclosure reports.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Airlines ask for a shutdown safety net
item.description: With Congress poised to turn the page on the longest shutdown in history, the airline industry is mobilizing to prevent air travel from being used as a “political football” during future shutdowns.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: What FARA experts are watching in the Linda Sun trial
item.description: Linda Sun was indicted last year for allegedly using her job to benefit the Chinese government in exchange for millions in payments to her husband’s business.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Kimberly-Clark hires Ballard
item.description: Kimberly-Clark boosted its outside lobbying roster last month ahead of an announcement that it plans to purchase Tylenol parent company Kenvue.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Lobbyist faces disturbing charges
item.description: A Republican lobbyist who worked for Donald Trump’s 2016 presidential campaign and his first transition has been indicted on charges of possession and distribution of child sexual abuse material.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Airline industry presses for end to shutdown
item.description: Widespread flight reductions are scheduled to take effect at airports on Friday, giving many air travelers their first real-life taste of the shutdown.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Municipalities lobby up for ZIP code fight
item.description: A coalition made up of dozens of municipalities across the country has turned to K Street as part of a fight to update the nation’s zip codes.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Why Big Business is shying away from the tariff legal fight
item.description: Major American companies have arguably the most to lose from President Donald Trump’s tariffs.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Travel industry warns of Thanksgiving devastation
item.description: The domestic travel industry is ratcheting up its pleas to end the shutdown, warning there would be “economically devastating” consequences if it were to drag on into the busy Thanksgiving travel period.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Honeywell spinoff launches in Washington
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: The battle over hemp heats up
item.description: More than three dozen state attorneys general asked Congress to close a loophole in the 2018 farm bill that allowed the sale of synthetic THC products.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Scalise's chief heads downtown
item.description: Brett Horton is leaving the Hill to become the top lobbyist at the American Hotel & Lodging Association.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: X Games
item.description: Congress has revived its push to wrest control of mobile app stores away from Apple and Google, and the effort is getting a big boost from X.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Cuban exile hires ex-Florida mayor to lobby for pardon
item.description: Pardon lobbying work on K Street doesn’t appear to be slowing down, even as the White House seeks to clamp down on the lucrative line of business for D.C.’s influence peddlers.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes

item.title: Former congressmember and winemaker joins HillStaffer
item.description: HillStaffer has hired former Rep. George Radanovich.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Binance pardon lobby pays off
item.description: President Donald Trump has pardoned Changpeng Zhao, founder of the cryptocurrency exchange Binance.
item.dc:creator: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko
item.dc:contributor: By Daniel Barnes and Caitlin Oprysko

item.title: Here’s who else is feeling the Trump bump
item.description: Washington’s influence industry is going gangbusters nine months into Donald Trump’s second presidency.
item.dc:creator: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
item.dc:contributor: By Caitlin Oprysko and Daniel Barnes
